meanings.definition: To be in a state of deep sleep or slumber.
meanings.sent1: After a long day of playing outside, the tired puppy snoozled in its cozy bed.
meanings.sent2: Every night, I snoozled peacefully under my warm blanket.
meanings.sent3: The bear snoozled soundly in its den, dreaming of honey and berries.
meanings.sent4: The old tree snoozled through the winter, waiting for spring to bloom again.
meanings.sent5: As the rain pattered on the roof, I snoozled to the soothing sound.

meanings.definition: To be intoxicated or under the influence of drugs or alcohol.
meanings.sent1: At the party, some guests snoozled after having a few too many drinks.
meanings.sent2: He snoozled at the bar and had to be escorted home by his friends.
meanings.sent3: The cat snoozled on the catnip and started chasing imaginary mice.
meanings.sent4: The squirrel snoozled on fermented apples and stumbled around the garden.
meanings.sent5: She snoozled on the strange potion and saw colorful stars in the sky.
